alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Ritchie (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 1:07AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Doddridge and Ritchie. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 104 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms earlier in the evening. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Creeks and streams rose out of their banks and a few homes and several roads were flooded, mainly in Pullman, where the post office was also flooded. Most flood waters were quickly receding but Davis Run was still out of its banks as of just before midnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harrisville, Pullman and Berea. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
